author: rjmholt
body:
The following tests to validate the PSReadLine installation failed in the latest release build:

https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/5b82b767558f682fef3ec53b5e5955981c2183ec/test/powershell/Modules/PSReadLine/PSReadLine.Tests.ps1#L11-L23

Error message:

```
Expected regular expression '^2.1.\d$' to match 2.0.4, but it did not match.
```

@daxian-dbw manually validated the installation on a Debian 11 machine and reported that this is a test bug rather than a release issue.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
> this is a test bug

Interesting! The error message reports that version 2.0.4 is installed. So the tests catch PSReadline pre-installed on system. But modules from Modules folder should be in priority. This looks like a bug with PSModulePath.

title: PSReadLine installation not registering on Debian
